page.title: 07HIGHFIELD FARM, LITTLEPORT
page.content: Highfield Farm is situated on the main A10 road to Ely, in Littleport itself. Highfield Farm is the largest owned by a large local firm. The farm has a dairy unit which is not typical of fen farms.The farm owns 127 cows, which are milked daily, and 1 bull. Young calves go to another of the firm's farms at{Black Horse {Drove,}a village 5 miles away, but the others will be sold to other farms. Highfield Farm covers 385 acres of land.The main item of machinery is the tractor, which is used to pull many implements such as ploughs & sprayers. In 1986 the new{bypass}will come to Littleport and it will split the farm. There is a{weather station}on the farm, which only has 21 inches of rain a year. The arable unit deals with growing crops such as sugarbeet, potatoes, cereals and carrots.
